name: sfchronicle
text: Alameda Police Chief Paul Rolleri announced his retirement Wednesday in a decision that comes in the wake of a controversial arrest of a Black man who was dancing in the street. https://t.co/cdd4FJMipc

name: sfchronicle
text: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak is suing YouTube and its parent company Google, alleging the companies failed to take down videos using his likenesses in a Bitcoin scam. https://t.co/izWGI9aKuZ

name: sfchronicle
text: The Oakland City council voted Tuesday night against cutting another $11 million from the police budget, meaning OPD will lose $14.6 million in funding instead of $25 million. Read more: https://t.co/ntZ3kXAtKB

name: sfchronicle
text: With the 49ers scheduled to report to training camp Tuesday, here’s a review of the major summer stories by @Eric_Branch: https://t.co/37LZGFl5lU

name: sfchronicle
text:
Gabe Kapler era finally begins as #SFGiants and Dodgers open season. 

via @JohnSheaHey: https://t.co/LkwxcdYqoz

name: sfchronicle
text: “Smaller, closed spaces are more likely to facilitate transmission. But at the same time, smaller places have fewer people so even if transmission occurs, the number of people getting infected is also going to be small.” https://t.co/YwVm1fWctX

name: sfchronicle
text: A surge in COVID-19 cases at Santa Rita Jail in Dublin appears to be coming under control, officials said. https://t.co/P82cLSNoTH

name: sfchronicle
text:
Giants manager Gabe Kapler, with players and coaches, took a knee during the national anthem, and more followed them the next day.

This reinforced the Bay Area’s standing as the sports world’s leader in kneeling and political protest, writes @ScottOstler. https://t.co/50LPfcc4wM

name: sfchronicle
text: Four additional people died from COVID-19 in Alameda County, bringing the total to 171 deaths as of Wednesday, according to data compiled by The Chronicle. The county recorded five deaths the day before. https://t.co/89seBfiHml
